Class CombinedHorizontalSymbolicAxis

                                +--com.jrefinery.chart.combination.CombinedHorizontalSymbolicAxis
All Implemented Interfaces:
AxisConstants, CombinableAxis, HorizontalAxis
Direct Known Subclasses:
OverlaidHorizontalSymbolicAxis
public class CombinedHorizontalSymbolicAxis
extends HorizontalSymbolicAxis
implements CombinableAxis

A combined horizontal Symbolic axis combines one or more HorizontalSymbolicAxes and aligns them for use in a CombinedPlot. This is needed to align properly all charts so that all vertical axis have the same width.

See Also:
CombinedPlot

setRange

public void setRange(AxisRange range)
Sets our AxisRange (min/max). This is done after a CombinedPlot has has calculated the overall range of all CombinedAxis that share the same Axis for all Plots. This makes all plots display the complete range of their Datasets.
Specified by:
setRange in interface CombinableAxis
Following copied from interface: com.jrefinery.chart.combination.CombinableAxis
Parameters:
range - The range.

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean flag)
Sets the visible flag on or off for this combined axis. A visible axis will display the axis title, ticks and legend depending on the parent's attributes. An invisible axis will not display anything. If the invisible axis isContainer(), then it occupies space on the graphic device.
Specified by:
setVisible in interface CombinableAxis
Following copied from interface: com.jrefinery.chart.combination.CombinableAxis
Parameters:
flag - New value of flag

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Is this axis visible? Is is drawn?
Specified by:
isVisible in interface CombinableAxis

setReserveDimension

public void setReserveDimension(double dimension)
The CombinedPlot will calculate the maximim of all reserveWidth or reserveHeight depending on the type of CombinedPlot and inform all CombinedXXXXXAxis to store this value.
Specified by:
setReserveDimension in interface CombinableAxis
Parameters:
dimension - If the axis is vertical, this is width. If axis is horizontal, then this is height
